content.p: Cookies help us to give you the best experience on our website. You can change your cookie settings if you wish. Otherwise we'll assume you're OK to continue.OKSee our policy Services and support with using learning technologies at Nottingham - from Moodle and accessibility support to digital skills and IT support. Moodle is our virtual learning environment. This is a central point to access teaching and learning resources for all of your modules, lecture notes, reading lists, assignment submissions and much more. You can login to Moodle using your university username and password. The service is available the day after you've completed online registration. Attend a Moodle for Study Success drop-in to get all your Moodle questions answered. To get started, log in with your UoN username and password Check your assignments for plagiarism before you submit it for marking. Our online help resources including answers to frequently asked questions For disabled students and those with a long-term health condition or learning difficulty How to access assistive software and use accessibility settings Converts documents into alternative formats at the touch of a button Free programme of academic, digital and information skills support Online course to help you make the transition to university study Our step-by-step guide to develop the skills you will need in your studies and future career Support and advice on all IT facilities Install the latest Office apps on up to five devices for free Request support with using UoN IT services King's Meadow Campus Lenton Lane Nottingham, NG7 2NR Please see our Help and support page for telephone and email contact points
